intro: Camelinopsis kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish camelinopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Camelinopsis kurdica is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
